name: places/ChIJkZrVi8dYwokRmcadCvi6Geo
formattedAddress: 77 Cherokee Pl, New York, NY 10075, USA
adrFormatAddress: 77 Cherokee Pl, New York, NY 10075, USA

editorialSummary.text: Public swimming complex with a 145-ft lap pool & 60-ft kids' pool open during the summer months.

originalText.text: I like this pool so clean the staff tried to make their best to let everybody go in so they made shifts

text.text: I like this pool so clean the staff tried to make their best to let everybody go in so they made shifts

originalText.text: My first time in the pool. Im proud to say I live in an area that still upkeeps one of the few surviving outdoor pools. The laws are enforced at this Public pool. Its cleaned, its manned with life guards, its got security checks .... doing a great job here.

text.text: My first time in the pool. Im proud to say I live in an area that still upkeeps one of the few surviving outdoor pools. The laws are enforced at this Public pool. Its cleaned, its manned with life guards, its got security checks .... doing a great job here.

originalText.text: A well maintained pool. I came here with a friend on a hot Wednesday afternoon (4:30pm). We had to wait because the pool was at capacity. The locker room and pool are both relatively clean. Come early if you don't want to wait because it seems to get crowded quickly!

text.text: A well maintained pool. I came here with a friend on a hot Wednesday afternoon (4:30pm). We had to wait because the pool was at capacity. The locker room and pool are both relatively clean. Come early if you don't want to wait because it seems to get crowded quickly!

originalText.text:
Terrible!! The staff at the pool change the rules without notice!! I am disabled and was turned away because I did not have a lock!! The items with me are necessary for medical reasons.. a pulse oximeter, a rescue inhailer, my oxygen tank, and in case of emergency my cellphone.  All of which I keep neatly in a cart with wheels.
I was turned away after waiting in 90-degree heat!! This violates every accessibility law! I am elderly in my mid-60s. They should be ashamed! I was allowed in the week before without question. Awful!

I was turned away after waiting in 90-degree heat!! This violates every accessibility law! I am elderly in my mid-60s. They should be ashamed! I was allowed in the week before without question. Awful!

originalText.text:
Nice pool and itâ€™s free to enter . However the jobsworth staff must think they are working at a prison ? They treat you with contempt unless you follow the below rules.

NO ENTRY WITHOUT A LOCK FOR YOUR LOCKER .
NO BAGS ALLOWED INSIDE POOL AREA .
NO T-SHIRTS ALLOWED TO BE WORN UNLESS WHITE IN COLOUR .
NO PHONES ALLOWED.
NO FOOD ALLOWED .
YOU MUST SHOWER BEFORE GOING INTO POOL AREA .
YOU MUST AGREE TO HAVING YOUR TOWEL SEARCHED BEFORE ENTERING.

We eventually got inside the pool after buying a lock from a shop 10 mins walk away . It opened at 11am and we finally got in at 11.40 am . Then a few mins later  very abruptly a pot bellied man used a very loud tannoy to announce that we all had to leave the pool at noon ( prison guard complex?)  because it was too hot ðŸ¥µ? It wasnâ€™t.
They gave no notice of this when people had entered and apparently they can do this on a whim or when one of them is having an off morning.
There were many upset locals who were regulars so this was unexpected for them too . If you wanted to go back outside and queue up for 40 mins or so in the sun then you could do so and get back inside .  Thanks for an entertaining morning guys I think everybody who works there needs to quit immediately and apply to Rikers Island . Goodbye forever !!
